articles.content:
Anniv. of July 26 Armed Uprising of Cuban people commemorated 
      Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- A gathering to mark the 46th anniversary of the July 26 Armed Uprising of the Cuban people was held at the Chollima House of Culture on Thursday.   Present at the gathering were Minister of Education Pyon Yong Rip who is also chairman of the Korea-Cuba Solidarity Committee, vice-chairman Kim Jin Bom of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, other officials concerned and working people in the city.   Invited there were Cuban ambassador to the DPRK Jose Manuel Inclan Embade and embassy officials.    Speeches were exchanged there.

articles.title: DPRK government memorandum supported abroad
articles.content:
Revision of "broadcasting law" demanded in South Korea
   Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- 60 civic and public organizations including the South Korean Confederation of Trade Unions and the Citizens' Federation for Democratic Society on July 20 held a joint press conference to join in the struggle of the trade unions of the "Munhwa Broadcasting Corporation" and the "Korean Broadcasting System" going on for 8 consecutive days, according to a Seoul-based radio.   The organizations demanded the revision of the "broadcasting law" and urged the present South Korean ruler to make a decision for the settlement of the issue.   Meanwhile, the trade unions reclarified a 5-point demand necessary for broadcasting reform and declared that they would go on strike until it is met.   And the joint emergency measure committee of the broadcasting trade union declared that if the "government" and ruling party don't show a responsible posture within this week, it will escalate the struggle in all sectors.

"Jonsung Cup" sports contest opens
    Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- The "Jonsung Cup" sports contest opened on Thursday to mark the 46th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War (July 27), the day of the second liberation.   The contest will include 10 sports events such as swimming, water polo, yachting  and water skiing.   Addressing the opening ceremony, chairman Mun Jae Dok of the Federation of Sports Technique under the Ministry of Sports and Physical Culture called upon all the sportsmen and sportswomen to display high sports technique and strong will so as to positively contribute to the development of national sports technique and adorn the contest with success.

articles.content:
Greetings to Egyptian President
   Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, yesterday sent a message of greetings to Mohamed Hosni Mubarak, President of the Arab Republic of Egypt, on the occasion of the 47th anniversary of the July 23 revolution, the national holiday of the Egyptian people.    Expressing  the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to grow stronger and develop, the message wished progress and wellbeing to the Egyptian people.
